alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 3:49PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Broward. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 347 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen from these slow moving thunderstorms. This area has also seen between 1 to 3 inches of rainfall over the last two days from previous storms each day. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Coral Springs, Davie, Plantation, Sunrise, Tamarac, Margate, Lauderhill, Weston, North Lauderdale, Cooper City, Sawgrass Mills Mall, Pine Island Ridge, Intersection I-75 And Griffin Road, Sunshine Acres, Nova Southeastern University, Royal Palm Ranches and Markham Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
